messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: [Rr]oom [0-9]+'

Imagine a building with six rooms. From the lobby you have two choices, you can go to room 1 or room 2. You enter room 1, at the other end of room 1 there's a door that leads to room 3, and room 3 leads to room 5. There's a chest in room 5. You open it and there's 10 dollars, but you do not take any money, you're just learning about the environment. Then you exit and start over. This time in the lobby you choose room 2, which has a door to room 4, and room 4 has a door that leads to room 6. You find a chest with 50 dollars in room 6, but you do not take any money, you're just learning about the environment. You return to the lobby. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money. Which room from the lobby will lead to the path where one can make the most money?

Here's a step-by-step guide to finding the room with the most money:
  1. Go through the door from the lobby to room 2.
  2. Open the chest within room 2 and retrieve its funds to deposit in the total account. Remember that you only go into the experience and back up by remembering what happened with your free discovery.
  3. Choose option of moving ahead through room door no 4 towards room number 6. Again, look into open and fund-laden chests inside Room 5 by checking their state and location in the room. You might discover other treasures besides cash as well in the form of goods and things (treasure rooms are hidden!). Once completed, do not select nor move any resources (remember play-style.) But remember to go'straight through' instead of backtracking (as before, avoid taking room door that led toward 2nd visit) when leaving rooms (including one that opens to chest. Go as the environment tells it and do backtrack to lobby instead.). Only backtrack 'home base 'once, before exploring Room 2 fully - you explore straight to point (chest open discovery. Check treasure count there and in lobby. And then note any chests you did encounter vs ones with treasures you saw count at chests opened), otherwise treat all pathways you try to open fully and learn about from beginning (including in lobby) to remember in all situations what was what from what direction to where when entering chests from any room.'

You enter the lobby and this time you encounter a new room, room 7. Room 7's door leads to room 8, and room 8 leads to room 9. Room 9 has a portal. From this portal itâ€™s possible to go to any neighboring room of room 4. When you return to the lobby and choose the path that leads to the most reward, you discover that the regular door to the room with the most money is blocked. You go back to the lobby. You will only be able to choose one path that leads to the most money. Which room from the lobby will lead to the path where one can make the most money?

Based on available information as new addition regarding room 7 appears, let us do following steps while we work together here based on best guess so your play can develop understanding about world- environment/area dynamics and features first hand! Here it is- Go door of the Lobby that does not overlap on an already chosen and discovered path: For this we will observe lobbies state before and after we travel, especially state-count room by examining them: Since a new entrance ' Room 8 via R9 portal now makes an entrance choice available,' consider Room II a most probably, not Rm. IV-6 for choice (R7/R1+4) given two discoverable portals one via room entrance and room. RII+IV vs.  R6. Which has not already choice yet since each room R' choice count would show RII choices not taken much in play count from beginning when compared, to count-value given new entry in 4 as least taken vs R6+O, a 3-choice explored. And Room selection 

After we go by room selection choice and open it - Room ROM, say, room ID II (conscience). Let your actions take it' first via chast or resources search as normal to update Room II Count based explored items you do and remove by updating your counts or not.' We observe it's a most like RII has not been explored at much before from choices not taken as explored, given choices only for portals, and then for only portal one with item chests seen not searched in as fully - then only the choices not explored with more or least chosen room visits by a given item placard that has value, would make which chests, items, would get in first. Based on dynamics for which choice of rooms has fewer visits that makes chests (thinking only one big reward) in their open positions. And there may very rare possibility room door leads elsewhere and the R4 path, where treasured chest was left in, and where two portals exit the area is hidden until visited at random chance' this chance we might have taken from prior information from not using it with item placards and not visiting them back at most often, yet for now just consider normal behavior, ' so when you open the door. Based your understanding for explored states now please guide me room choice you think will generate more count at any explored place after count and room reentry you'd suggest and tell why.
